rules.question: Did you hit, injure or fall on your upper arm or shoulder recently?
rules.diagnosis: Your SHOULDER may be or may have been DISLOCATED.

rules.question: Is your upper arm swollen or misshaped?
rules.diagnosis: Your HUMERUS (upper arm bone) may be FRACTURED.
rules.selfcare: EMERGENCY Call your doctor or go to the emergency room right away.

rules.question: Is your collarbone tender, or do you have a bump on it?
rules.selfcare: Call your doctor right away. Use a sling to restrict movement of your arm and use an analgesic, such as acetaminophen or ibuprofen, to relieve pain until you see your doctor.

rules.question: Is there tenderness or pain near the shoulder end of your collarbone, and does lifting your arm with your uninjured arm help the pain?
rules.selfcare: Call your doctor right away. Use a sling to restrict movement of your arm and use an analgesic, such as acetaminophen or ibuprofen, to relieve pain until you see your doctor.

rules.question: Does pain come with a twisting motion of your arm, or does a throwing motion cause pain and does your shoulder seem weak?
rules.diagnosis: You may have a TORN ROTATOR CUFF or SHOULDER INSTABILITY

rules.question: Do you have redness or swelling around your shoulder?
rules.diagnosis: You may have INFLAMMATION in or around a joint, also called BURSITIS, or a serious INFECTION of the bone, the joint or the skin.
rules.selfcare: URGENT See your doctor right away.

rules.question: Within the last month have you had a sore through or a skin rash
rules.diagnosis: These symptoms may be from RHEUMATIC FEVER.
rules.selfcare: URGENT See your doctor right away.

rules.question: Do you have redness and swellinig in more than one joint, including your shoulder?
rules.diagnosis: You may have RHEUMATOID ARTHRITIS a disease affecting the immune system, or GOUT, an inflammation of the shoulder joint.
rules.selfcare: See your doctor. Apply heat to the affected area and take an anti-inflammatory medicine, such as ibuprofen, for pain.

rules.question: Do you feel pain when you move your shoulder but there's no swelling or redness?
rules.diagnosis: You may have BURSITIS or ROTATOR CUFF SYNDROME
rules.selfcare: Use an anti-inflammatory medicine, such as ibuprofen, and apply heat to the affected area. If your symptoms do not improve, see your doctor.

rules.question: Do you have increasing stiffness and inability to move your shoulder?
rules.diagnosis: You may have ADHESIVE CAPSULITIS, also called a FROZEN SHOULDER.
rules.selfcare: See your doctor. This condition is usually treated with special exercises your can do on your own.

rules.question: This expert system has run out of questions. Seek medical attention if problem persist.
rules.diagnosis: For more information, please talk to your doctor. If you think the problem is serious, call your doctor right away.
rules.selfcare: For more information, please talk to your doctor. If you think the problem is serious, call your doctor right away.
